articles.title: A hidden brain signal may reveal Alzheimer’s long before diagnosis
articles.description: Researchers have discovered a brain activity pattern that can predict which people with mild cognitive impairment are likely to develop Alzheimer’s disease. articles.title: The oxygen you breathe depends on a tiny ocean ingredient
articles.description: Microscopic ocean algae produce a huge share of Earth’s oxygen—but they need iron to do it. New field research shows that when iron is scarce, phytoplankton waste energy and photosynthesis falters. Climate-driven changes may reduce iron delivery to the oceans, weakening the base of marine food chain

articles.title: Canadian ice master makes Olympic history with the Games’ 1st indoor temporary speedskating rink
articles.description: RHO, Italy (AP) — No ice is colder and harder than speedskating ice. The precision it takes has meant that Olympic speedskaters have never competed for gold on a temporary indoor rink – until the 2026 Milan Cortina Winter Games.
